para.text: The Executive Office of the Mayor shall develop and publish a Comprehensive Public Safety Plan ("Plan") no later than one year after the applicability date of this section.
The Plan shall include decisions and assessments based on evidence and research on:
Crime statistics that include collection of data on violent crimes, property crimes, other various types of crime, and geographic distribution of crimes;

Community perception surveys, which include surveys from citizens of the District about the perception of safety, concerns with law enforcement entities, feedback on police effectiveness, and trust in law enforcement; and

Data on socioeconomic factors including data on education attainment, employment status, housing stability, poverty rates, and graduation rates to identify a correlation and understand the contribution between such factors and crime.
The Executive Office of the Mayor shall develop and publish an updated Plan no later than 4 years after the publication of the initial plan, and every 4 years thereafter.
